pain_points.description: Navigation issues when returning to the calendar of events.
supporting_quotes: each time I want to go back to the calendar of events after clicking on an event, it goes back to the beginning of like many months ago.
I have to scroll down, try to find it.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Frequently mentioned as a significant frustration.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Manually scrolls back to the desired date and changes the view to list view.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Increases time spent navigating the website and adds unnecessary steps to find relevant events.

pain_points.description: Lack of day-of-week information for event dates.
supporting_quotes: it often would put the date, like November 14th, but it doesn't say what day of the week it is.
to me, it's very important if I know if it's a Saturday or Monday through Friday at 10am when I can't do it kind of thing.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Previously a significant issue, but resolved.
pain_points.current_workarounds: None, as this pain point has been addressed.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Previously caused confusion in planning attendance for events.

pain_points.description: Difficulty understanding the overall structure of the website and where to find certain documents.
supporting_quotes: it's not always clear where that stuff is.
it's, you need to kind of search those out.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Mentioned but not emphasized as a major frustration.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Users may explore the website to find necessary information.
pain_points.impact_on_user: May lead to frustration and wasted time trying to locate information.

pain_points.description: Concerns about access to events and information as an alumni.
supporting_quotes: I know that I'll be popped out of like seeing full calendar and I'll only have to view the public events calendar.
how will we find out about those when we graduate?
pain_points.frequency_severity: Significant concern for future use of the website.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Currently uncertain; waiting for potential updates.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Potential loss of connection to community and events after graduation.

pain_points.description: Overall aesthetic and invitation of the website.
supporting_quotes: it's not super pretty or anything like that, but it's not bad.
it needs to be prettied up a little bit just to be more attractive.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Mentioned as a general observation, not a primary pain point.
pain_points.current_workarounds: None; users have adjusted to the current design.
pain_points.impact_on_user: May affect first impressions for new users.

supporting_quotes: the job form is a nightmare for most.
pain_points.frequency_severity: Noted as a significant issue, but not the main focus of the interview.
pain_points.current_workarounds: Delegation to others who find it less complicated.
pain_points.impact_on_user: Frustration and reliance on others to complete tasks.
